newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Itochu eyes Philippine power plant.
newsitem.headline: Itochu eyes Philippine power plant.

text.p: Four foreign companies, including Itochu Corp of Japan, have expressed interest in challenging an offer made by a consortium to build a 304-megawatt power plant in Batangas, south of Manila.

An official at the state-owned National Power Corp (Napcor) said on Tuesday that Itochu, Nissho Iwai of Japan, Salcon Power Corp of Singapore and California Energy of the United States have bought bid documents to challenge the offer earlier made by San Pascual Cogeneration Co.
San Pascual, which is made up of Texaco Inc, Caltex (Philippines) Inc and Edison Mission Energy, has proposed producing electricity at 1.36 pesos per kilowatthour.
The power plant is to power the Caltex oil refinery, a coconut oil refining plant and the Luzon power grid.
The challengers are expected to give a lower power cost for the Napocor to junk the original offer.
The different project proposals will be opened on January 9, 1997. - Manila newsroom 63 2 8418938 Fax 8176267
